summary.para: Registers a platform work queue with Multimedia Class Scheduler Service (MMCSS) using the specified class and task id.

param.name: dwPlatformWorkQueue
param.para: The id of one of the standard platform work queues.

param.name: wszClass
param.para: The MMCSS class which the work queue should be registered with.

param.name: dwTaskId
param.para: The task id which the work queue should be registered with. If dwTaskId is 0, a new MMCSS bucket will be created.

param.name: pCallback
param.para: Standard callback used for async operations in Media Foundation.

param.name: pState
param.para: Standard state used for async operations in Media Foundation.

returns.para: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

summary.para: Gets the priority of the Multimedia Class Scheduler Service (MMCSS) priority associated with the specified platform work queue.

param.name: dwPlatformWorkQueueId
param.para: Topology work queue id for which the info will be returned.

returns.para: Pointer to a buffer allocated by the caller that the work queue's MMCSS task id will be copied to.

summary.para: Retrieves the Multimedia Class Scheduler Service (MMCSS) string associated with the given topology work queue.

param.name: dwTopologyWorkQueueId
param.para: The id of the topology work queue.

param.name: plPriority
param.para: Pointer to the buffer the work queue's MMCSS task id will be copied to.

returns.para: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

remarks.para: This interface allows applications to control both platform and topology work queues.
The can be obtained from the session by querying for the MF_WORKQUEUE_SERVICES service.
